newsitem.title: INDONESIA: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - April 29.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - April 29.

text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Indonesian press on April 29. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

Officials from the government-backed faction of the Indonesian Democratic Party (PDI) have said they will not campaign in the East Java capital Surabaya after they clashed with supporters of ousted leader Megawati Sukarnoputri during a rally on Monday.
Problems of education and unemployment were spotlighted by the PDI on their first official day of campaigning on the main island of Java.

Nine activists from the unrecognised People's Democratic Party (PRD) were sentenced for subversion with jail terms ranging from 13 years to 18 months after they were arrested in the wake of riots in the capital last July.
Mining Minister Ida Bagus Sudjana has awarded 65 mining contracts of work (COW) to joint ventures and foreign companies to explore for gold, nickel and diamonds in Indonesia.

A number of state-owned banks are said to be preparing to lend $1.2 billion to a firm controlled by President Suharto's youngest son Hutomo Mandala Putra which has been given special priveleges to produce a national care with KIA Motors of South Korea.
Hutomo Mandala Putra will marry a descendent of Javanese royalty on Wednesday in a traditional Javanese ceremony at Jakarta Beautiful Indonesia in Minature theme park built by his late mother.
